meanings.definition: The act of turning something into text.
meanings.sent1: Textualization is important for preserving information.
meanings.sent2: The textualization of historical documents helps us understand the past.
meanings.sent3: I find the textualization of recipes quite fascinating.
meanings.sent4: Her speech was a perfect textualization of her thoughts.
meanings.sent5: The textualization of laws makes them easier to reference.

meanings.definition: The process of incorporating something into a text.
meanings.sent1: In academic writing, textualization involves citing sources properly.
meanings.sent2: The textualization of quotes adds credibility to the article.
meanings.sent3: The textualization of jokes into a speech can be tricky.
meanings.sent4: The textualization of emotions in her writing was powerful.
meanings.sent5: Textualization of feedback can help improve communication.

meanings.definition: The transformation of something into written form.
meanings.sent1: Textualization is essential for documenting oral traditions.
meanings.sent2: The textualization of ideas can make them more accessible.
meanings.sent3: I never realized the complexity of textualization until now.
meanings.sent4: The textualization of memories can bring them to life.
meanings.sent5: Textualization of thoughts can lead to better understanding.
